intro: Tabernaemontana vanheurckii, commonly known as the Vanheurck's star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
